content.new: When the camera is inside the bounding box of an object (e.g. driver's seat of the polaris ranger) then the model seems to be ignored when ray-tracing the position for the orbit viewer's focal point. This then causes the point to be set somewhere far out
content.old: When the camera is inside the bounding box of an object (e.g. driver's seat of the polaris ranger) then the model seems to be ignored when ray-tracing the position for the orbit viewer's focal point. This then causes the point to be set somewhere far out

issue.title: orbit view focal point ray-tracing ignores object when inside bounding-box
